wikipedia_page.main: Second Lieutenant Donald Simpson Bell, VC (3 December 1890 – 10 July 1916) was an English school teacher and professional footballer. During World War I he was awarded the Victoria Cross for actions during the Battle of the Somme in mid-1916.

response: *Donald Simpson Bell, (1890-1916), First World War Victoria Cross recipient

response: | Donald Simpson Bell || British Army || 1916 || First World War || Somme
* Second Lieutenant Donald Simpson Bell, VC (5 July 1916)

link_mentions.page: Association football during World War I
response: A number of British footballers received medals for bravery during World War I, including Bernard Vann (MC and VC), Donald Simpson Bell (VC), William Angus (VC), Jimmy Speirs (MM), Tim Coleman (MM) and Davie Glen (MM).
*Donald Simpson Bell (the only English professional football player to be awarded the Victoria Cross during World War I).Donald Bell: English professional football's only VC
